study.title: Surgical site infection and antimicrobial prophylaxis prescribing profile, and its determinants among hospitalized patients in Northeast Ethiopia: a hospital based cross-sectional study

design.inclusion_criteria_text: Adult patients of age >18 years, patients on at least one prophylaxis antibiotic, and wounds classified as clean, clean-contaminated, and contaminated.
design.exclusion_criteria_text: Patients who received therapeutic antimicrobials during hospitalization before surgery for a comorbid condition and those with a history of previous admission for a similar surgical procedure were excluded. Patients with incomplete information were also excluded.

country_specific_sites: Debre Berhan Comprehensive Specialized Hospital, Debre Berhan, Amhara, Ethiopia

eligibility.population: Adult patients (>18 years) admitted for surgical procedures, receiving at least one prophylactic antibiotic, with wounds classified as clean, clean-contaminated, or contaminated.
eligibility.intervention: Surgical antimicrobial prophylaxis (SAP) with one or two antibiotics, mainly ceftriaxone or ceftriaxone plus metronidazole.
eligibility.comparator: Appropriate vs inappropriate SAP use (selection, timing, duration); no explicit alternative regimens.

populations.description: All eligible adult patients admitted for surgical procedures at DBCSH during study period
populations.comorbidities_key: 22.1% had comorbidities (hypertension 40%, peptic ulcer disease 22.2%, HIV 13.3%, diabetes 13.3%, others 11.1%)

provenance.text_snippet: A total of 204 patients were assessed... Table 1

definitions.outcome_definitions_text: SSI: infection at or near surgical incision within 30 days of operation or after one year in case of implant, confirmed by clinical signs and symptoms. Appropriate SAP: right antimicrobial, indication, timing, duration per guidelines.

lab_methods.lab_capacity_notes: No culture and sensitivity testing performed; absence noted as limitation.

ssi_incidence.notes: SSI defined by clinical signs/symptoms; no microbiological confirmation.

provenance.text_snippet: Occurrence of SSI. In our study 126 (61.8%) patients have developed SSI

ssi_incidence.notes: Among SSI cases, 58% were superficial incisional.
Among SSI cases, 42% were deep incisional.

risk_factors_effects.covariates_adjusted_for: Multivariable logistic regression; covariates not fully specified.
risk_factors_effects.notes: Duration >1 hour independently associated with increased SSI risk.

provenance.section_heading: Determinants of surgical site infection occurrence
provenance.text_snippet: Duration of surgery >1 h, AOR = 3.39 (95% CI: 1.24–9.30)

risk_factors_effects.covariates_adjusted_for: Multivariable logistic regression; covariates not fully specified.
risk_factors_effects.notes: Inappropriate SAP independently associated with increased SSI risk.

provenance.section_heading: Determinants of surgical site infection occurrence

interventions.description: Surgical antimicrobial prophylaxis with ceftriaxone (70.5%), ceftriaxone plus metronidazole (21.9%), metronidazole (5.7%), or ampicillin (1.9%) for prevention of SSI.
interventions.comparator: Appropriate vs inappropriate SAP use (selection, timing, duration)

provenance.section_heading: Determinants of surgical site infection occurrence

stewardship_guidelines.guideline_name: ASHP, UpToDate v21.6, Ethiopian Ministry of Health
stewardship_guidelines.adherence_definition: Appropriate SAP: right antimicrobial, indication, timing, duration per guideline.
stewardship_guidelines.inappropriate_use_definition: Inappropriate selection, timing, or duration of SAP.

provenance.section_heading: Utilization pattern and appropriateness of SAP
provenance.text_snippet: In this study, 159 (77.9%) patients were exposed to inappropriate use of surgical antimicrobial prophylaxis

policy_capacity.status_text: No culture and sensitivity testing performed for SSI diagnosis; absence noted as limitation.

provenance.text_snippet: absence of recommended prophylactic antibiotics use due to the lack of a culture and sensitivity study

codes.summary: SSI incidence was high (61.8%) among surgical patients, with most infections occurring before discharge.

evidence_quotes.quote: In our study 126 (61.8%) patients have developed SSI, of which 73 (58%) were superficial incisional SSI and the rest were deep incisional SSI.

codes.location_context: Debre Berhan Comprehensive Specialized Hospital, Ethiopia

provenance.text_snippet: Occurrence of SSI. In our study 126 (61.8%) patients have developed SSI

codes.summary: Inappropriate selection, timing, and duration of SAP were common, with 77.9% of patients exposed to inappropriate prophylaxis.

evidence_quotes.quote: In this study, 159 (77.9%) patients were exposed to inappropriate use of surgical antimicrobial prophylaxis as per different guidelines.
evidence_quotes.section: Utilization pattern and appropriateness of SAP

codes.location_context: Debre Berhan Comprehensive Specialized Hospital, Ethiopia

provenance.section_heading: Utilization pattern and appropriateness of SAP
provenance.text_snippet: In this study, 159 (77.9%) patients were exposed to inappropriate use of surgical antimicrobial prophylaxis

codes.summary: Absence of culture and sensitivity testing and lack of antimicrobial stewardship programs were noted as barriers to effective SSI prevention.

evidence_quotes.quote: The higher rate of SSI in the study area despite the institution of surgical antibiotic prophylaxis calls for the consideration of definitive laboratory diagnosis with culture and sensitivity study to come up with recommended antibiotics usage.

codes.location_context: Debre Berhan Comprehensive Specialized Hospital, Ethiopia

provenance.text_snippet: calls for the consideration of definitive laboratory diagnosis with culture and sensitivity study

codes.summary: Recommendation to include clinical pharmacists in surgical ward teams to improve SAP utilization.

evidence_quotes.quote: Including clinical pharmacists in the surgical ward service team should be also considered to ensure proper surgical antibiotic prophylaxis utilization.

codes.location_context: Debre Berhan Comprehensive Specialized Hospital, Ethiopia

provenance.text_snippet: Including clinical pharmacists in the surgical ward service team should be also considered

codes.summary: No microbiological confirmation of SSI; lack of data on AMR patterns and absence of culture and sensitivity testing.

evidence_quotes.quote: This means the pathogens responsible for surgical site infections may not have been covered by the prophylactic antibiotics or they may have developed resistance to these agents.

codes.location_context: Debre Berhan Comprehensive Specialized Hospital, Ethiopia

provenance.text_snippet: pathogens responsible for surgical site infections may not have been covered
No risk of bias assessment reported.
